Rose diagram (2D)

Source: R/rose_diag_2D.R
rose_diag_2D.Rd

Plots a rose diagram for angular (dip direction or strike) data.

rose_diag_2D(x, width = 30, dir = 1, conf.level = 0.95)

Arguments

x

A vector of angular measurements in degrees
width

Petal width
dir

A logical indicating if the data are directional (1) or non-directional (0)
conf.level

Confidence level to use for the cone of confidence (Default is 0.95)

Value

A ggplot obejct

Details

Directional data refers to dipping planes or lines, data expressed as dip direction (trend). Non-directional data refers to strike or lineations expressed as azimuths that can take two angles (i.e. 45 or 225). The mean direction and cone of confidence are displayed as red and cyan lines respectively.

Examples

x = c(255, 239, 222, 231, 199, 271, 222, 274, 228, 246,
      177, 199, 257, 201, 237, 209, 216, 180, 182, 250,
      219, 196, 197, 246, 218, 235, 232, 243, 232, 180,
      231, 254, 242, 149, 212, 210, 230, 205, 220, 268)
rose_diag_2D(x, width = 30, dir = 1)

# non-directional data example
rose_diag_2D(carolina, width = 10, dir = 0)
